Package org.jtrim2.event

Class ProxyListenerRegistry<ListenerType>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.event.ProxyListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
Type Parameters:
ListenerType - the type of the event listeners can possibly be added to the container
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
public final class ProxyListenerRegistry<ListenerType> extends Object implements SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
Defines a SimpleListenerRegistry which is backed by another SimpleListenerRegistry. The backing SimpleListenerRegistry can be replaced by another SimpleListenerRegistry by calling the replaceRegistry method.

Listeners added to this listener registry will also be added to the backing SimpleListenerRegistry. When replacing the backing listener registry, these listeners will be unregistered from the registry backing the ProxyListenerRegistry and will be registered with the newly added listener registry.

Warning: Adding a listener to the ProxyListenerRegistry will retain a reference to the listener even if the listener is automatically unregistered by the backing listener registry.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProxyListenerRegistry

      public ProxyListenerRegistry(SimpleListenerRegistry<? super ListenerType> initialRegistry)
      Creates a new ProxyListenerRegistry which is initially backed by the passed ListenerRegistry. This listener registry can be replaced later by a replaceRegistry call.

      Note that the ProxyListenerRegistry is only aware of listeners added through the ProxyListenerRegistry itself. Listeners directly added to the backing listener registry will not affect the ProxyListenerRegistry.

      Parameters:
      initialRegistry - the initial backing listener registry. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener registry is null

  • Method Details

    • replaceRegistry

      public void replaceRegistry(SimpleListenerRegistry<? super ListenerType> registry)
      Unregisters already added listeners from the current backing registry and registers them with the specified listener registry. The listener registry passed to this method will be the new registry backing this ProxyListenerRegistry.

      Note that this ProxyListenerRegistry is only aware of listeners added through the ProxyListenerRegistry itself. Listeners directly added to the backing listener registry will not affect this ProxyListenerRegistry.

      Warning: Listeners will not be notified by this method. If you need to notify client code, you have to do so manually by calling the onEvent method.

      Parameters:
      registry - the new listener registry backing this ProxyListenerRegistry. This argument cannot be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener registry is null

    • onEvent

      public <ArgType> void onEvent(EventDispatcher<? super ListenerType,? super ArgType> eventDispatcher, ArgType arg)
      Invokes the onEvent method of the specified EventDispatcher with the currently registered listeners and the argument specified. The onEvent method is called synchronously in the current thread. Note that this method will only notify listeners added through this ProxyListenerRegistry as it does not know about listeners added directly to the backing listener registry.

      Adding new listeners to this container will have no effect on the current call and the listeners being notified. That is, if a notified listener adds a new listener to this container, the newly added listener will not be notified in this call, only in subsequent onEvent calls.

      The order in which the listener are notified is undefined. Also note, that multiply added listener might be notified multiple times depending on the exact implementation.

      Type Parameters:
      ArgType - the type of the argument which is passed to event listeners
      Parameters:
      eventDispatcher - the EventDispatcher whose onEvent method is to be called for every registered listener with the specified argument. The onEvent method will be called as many times as many currently registered listeners are. This argument cannot be null.
      arg - the argument to be passed to every invocation of the onEvent method of the specified EventDispatcher. This argument can be null if the EventDispatcher allows for null arguments.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified EventDispatcher is null
      See Also:
      • TaskScheduler

    • registerListener

      public ListenerRef registerListener(ListenerType listener)
      Adds an event listener to this container and returns a reference which can later be used to removed the listener added.

      Subsequent event notifications will notify the added listener unless it is removed using the returned reference.

      It doesn't matter if the listener was already added. In case the given listener have been added to this ListenerRegistry it will be added again causing the added listener to be notified as many times as it has been added. Note that the equals method of the listener should have no effect regarding this ListenerRegistry.

      If a listener is removed but it was added multiple times, it will be removed only once. So, further event notifications will be delivered to the listener one less time.

      Warning: Adding a listener to the ProxyListenerRegistry may retain a reference to the listener even if the listener is automatically unregistered by the backing listener registry.

      Specified by:
      registerListener in interface SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to be added to this container and be notified in subsequent event notifications method calls. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
